content.heading: Web Storage Overview
paragraphs: Web Storage API stores data locally, offering â‰¥5MB capacity and better security than cookies.

content.heading: Storage Types
paragraphs: - sessionStorage: Data for one session, cleared on tab close

content.heading: Basic Usage
paragraphs:
<script>
const x = document.getElementById("result");
if (typeof(Storage) !== "undefined") {
  localStorage.setItem("lastname", "Smith");
  x.innerHTML = localStorage.getItem("lastname");
} else {
  x.innerHTML = "No Web Storage support.";
}
</script>

content.heading: Click Counter Example
paragraphs:
<script>
function clickCounter() {
  const x = document.getElementById("result");
  if (typeof(Storage) !== "undefined") {
    localStorage.clickcount = localStorage.clickcount ? Number(localStorage.clickcount) + 1 : 1;
    x.innerHTML = "Clicked " + localStorage.clickcount + " time(s)!";
  } else {
    x.innerHTML = "No Web Storage support.";
  }
}
</script>

content.heading: Browser Support
paragraphs: Supported by Chrome 4.0, IE 8.0, Firefox 3.5, Safari 4.0, Opera 11.5.
